title: Blue Origin to halt space tourism flights for at least two years
description: Plan is to shift resources to the development of its moon lander, needed by NASA to carry astronauts to the moon for the Artemis program.

Article content

Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin will pause tourist flights to space for “no less than two years” in order to shift resources to accelerating the development of its moon lander and other lunar technologies, the company announced.

Article content

“The decision reflects Blue Origin’s commitment to the nation’s goal of returning to the Moon and establishing a permanent, sustained lunar presence,” Blue Origin said in a statement announcing the news.

Article content

The decision effectively grounds the company’s reusable New Shepard rocket, which has launched 38 times and sent more than 90 people to the edge of space and back to experience brief periods of weightlessness. Bezos flew on the first crewed flight of New Shepard in 2021.
